text: Submitted my doctoral dissertation!
**"Whose Side Are You On?" Estimating Ideology of Political and News Content Using Large Language Models and Few-shot Demonstration Selection** was accepted at IJCNLP-AACL.
Served as a reviewer for AISec '25.
Interned at the **Data AI** and **Superintelligence Labs** at **Meta**.
**Re-ranking Using Large Language Models for Mitigating Exposure to Harmful Content on Social Media Platforms** was accepted at ACL.
Passed the Doctoral Qualifying Exam and advanced to PhD candidacy.
**Nudging the Recommendation Algorithm Increases News Consumption and Diversity on YouTube** was accepted at PNAS Nexus.
Invited to attend **Meta Research Day** at their Menlo Park office.
Presented at **Trust & Safety Research Conference** at Stanford University.
Awarded the **GGCS Research Fellowship ($18,000)** for Summer 2024.
Attended the **Trust & Safety Research Conference** at Stanford University.
Attended the third annual **ProperData Symposium** at Northeastern University.
Awarded the **GGCS Research Fellowship ($18,000)** for Summer 2023.
**Auditing YouTube's Recommendation System for Ideologically Congenial, Extreme, and Problematic Recommendations** was accepted in PNAS.
Awarded the **GGCS Research Fellowship ($7,177)** for Spring 2023.
Launched [**Nothing to Hide? A Data Privacy Podcast**](https://nothingtohide.online).
Attended the second annual **ProperData Symposium** at UC Irvine.
Attended the **UC Noyce Initiative Symposium '22** at UC Santa Barbara.
Presented at the **UC Davis Noyce Workshop**.
Research featured in the [**UC Davis College of Engineering News**](https://cs.ucdavis.edu/news/do-youtube-recommendations-foster-political-radicalization).
Presented at the **Politics and Computational Social Science** (PaCSS) conference at Harvard University.
Participated and presented at the **Summer Institute in Computational Social Science** (SICSS) at the University of Pennsylvania.
Attended the **International AAAI Conference on Web and Social Media '22** (ICWSM) in Atlanta.
Attended the **IEEE Symposium on Security & Privacy '22** (Oakland) in San Francisco.
Attended the **ProperData Symposium** at UC Irvine.
**HARPO: Learning to Subvert Online Behavioral Advertising** was accepted at NDSS'22.
Left TPI lab and joined the PhD program at UC Davis.
